intro: Hieracium hookeri, commonly known as Hooker's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium hookeri is often found in mountainous areas of Chile and Argentina, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
